itemDescription: British social reformer, founder of "Save the Children"

wikipedia_page.main: Eglantyne Jebb  (25 August 1876 – 17 December 1928) was a British social reformer who founded the Save the Children organisation at the end of the First World War to relieve the effects of famine in Austria-Hungary and Germany. She drafted the document that became the Declaration of the Rights of the Child.
